alert.note: Alert for Erie; Lorain (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 24 at 3:29PM EDT until August 25 at 1:00PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio... Huron River Near Milan affecting Erie County. Black River At Elyria affecting Lorain County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Ohio... Vermilion River Near Vermilion affecting Lorain and Erie Counties. For the Huron River...including Milan...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Vermilion River...including Vermilion...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Black River...including Elyria...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Vermilion River Near Vermilion. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 9.5 feet, State Route 60 in Huron County inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 8.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage again this evening to a crest of 9.5 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.4 feet on 02/21/1955. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 130 AM EDT.
